text: __NOTOC__ Sir Francis Verner Wylie (9 August 1891 – 1970) was an Indian Civil Servant.Wylie, Sir Francis Verner (1891-1970) Knight Indian Civil Servant, National Register of Archives, UK. Francis Wylie was educated in Ireland at the Royal School, Dungannon, in County Tyrone, Ulster, and at Trinity College, Dublin. He entered the Indian Civil Service (ICS) in 1914.Governor of UP , India. In 1915, he arrived in India and was on military duty, from 1916–19. During 1919–38 He served in the Indian Political Service and was appointed Governor of Central Provinces and Berar during 1938–40. He was Political Adviser to the Crown Representative during 1940–41 and 1943–45. In 1941, Wylie succeeded Sir William Fraser-Tytler as British minister in Kabul, Afghanistan. From 1945–47 he was Governor of the United Provinces.Provinces of British India . In 1948, Wylie was appointed the British Government Director of the Suez Canal Company. In this capacity, he wrote several reports for the Suez Canal Company to the British Government.The Papers of Sir Alexander George Montagu Cadogan (1884–1968), Janus, University of Cambridge, UK. Francis Wylie was married to Kathleen. ==Titles== * 1865–1929: Francis Verner Wylie * 1929–1938: Francis Verner Wylie, CIE * 1938–1947: Sir Francis Verner Wylie, KCSI, CIE * 1947–1952: Sir Francis Verner Wylie, GCIE, KCSI ==See also== * List of Governors of the Central Provinces and Berar * Timeline of Afghanistan (1941) ==References== ==External links== * Pictures in the National Portrait Gallery, London Category:1891 births Category:1970 deaths Category:People from County Tyrone Category:Alumni of Trinity College Dublin Category:Indian Civil Service (British India) officers Category:Knights Commander of the Order of the Star of India Category:Knights Grand Commander of the Order of the Indian Empire Category:People educated at the Royal School Dungannon Category:Administrators in British India
